column2: [U] the sport or activity of diving without the aid of breathing equipment （不使用呼吸装备的) 自由潜水
column3: e.g. They noticed she was very good at holding her breath and suggested she try [[freediving]].

column2: [C] (also championships) a competition to find which player, team, etc. is the best in a particular sport 锦标赛；冠军赛
column3: e.g. The sixth game of the World Chess [[Championship]] will be broadcast tonight on Channel 6.

column2: not studying or looking at sth. carefully and only seeing the most noticeable things 肤浅的；浅薄的；不深入的
column3: e.g. Unfortunately I only had a very [[superficial]] knowledge of music.

column2: (fml.) in spite of the fact that has just been mentioned 然而；但是；尽管如此；虽然如此
column3: e.g. The region was extremely beautiful. [[Nonetheless]], Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.

column2: [C] sb. who is watching an event or a game （活动或体育比赛的）观看者，观众
column3: e.g. The final baseball game which was held last Thursday attracted a crowd of over 50,000 [[spectators]].

column2: [C] sb. who swims or works under water, usu. with special equipment to help them breathe （通常使用特种呼吸辅助装备的）潜水员
column3: e.g. Twenty minutes later, a [[diver]] surfaced and handed a metal box to the elderly gentleman.

column2: hang or swing loosely, or make sth. do this （使）悬垂；（使）吊着；（使）悬荡
column3: e.g. We stood in the orchard (果园), where the apples were ripe and [[dangled]] just inches above our heads.

column2: make sb. feel extremely frightened 使恐惧；使十分害怕；使惊吓
column3: e.g. He had imagined that going down in the caves late at night would [[terrify]] her, but instead she felt surprisingly calm.

column2: not covered by any clothes 裸体的；裸露的
column3: e.g. While she was walking around her house in [[bare]] feet, her mom just didn't seem to notice.

column2: 1) one of a set of movements in swimming or rowing in which you move your arms or the oar forward and then back （游泳或划船的）一次划水
column3: e.g. She walked into the water and began to swim with strong [[strokes]] to the middle of the lake.；e.g. It is reported that air pollution could also restrict blood flow, causing [[strokes]] and heart attacks.

column2: 2) a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly 脑卒中；中风
column3: e.g. She walked into the water and began to swim with strong [[strokes]] to the middle of the lake.；e.g. It is reported that air pollution could also restrict blood flow, causing [[strokes]] and heart attacks.

column2: make sth. less tight or firmly fixed; become less tight or firmly fixed （使）放松；变松
column3: e.g. He took a screwdriver (螺丝刀) from his pocket and began to [[loosen]] the screws on the bike.

column2: [C] sb. who jumps from a plane and falls for as long as they can before opening the parachute （延缓张伞的）特技跳伞运动员
column3: e.g. As a [[skydiver]] falls, he accelerates downward, gaining speed with each second.

column2: n.[C] a particular position in which sb. stands, sits, etc., esp. in order to be painted, drawn or photographed （为画像、拍照等摆的）姿势
column3: e.g. Please ask the model to stay in that [[pose]] anywhere from 30 seconds to 1 minute.；e.g. Concerns about the danger [[posed]] by fireworks could lead to restrictions on their sale and use.

column2: vt.create a threat, problem, etc. that has to be dealt with 造成（威胁、问题等）；引起；产生
column3: e.g. Please ask the model to stay in that [[pose]] anywhere from 30 seconds to 1 minute.；e.g. Concerns about the danger [[posed]] by fireworks could lead to restrictions on their sale and use.

column2: disappear suddenly and / or in a way that you cannot explain （莫名奇妙地）突然消失
column3: e.g. Three boats [[vanished]] without a trace one day and have never been found.

column2: [U] 声呐（船上或潜艇上利用声波探测水下目标位置的仪器）
[C, U] (fml.) the process of going down 下降；降落
column3: e.g. The night turned cold and heavy rain began to fall during our [[descent]] from the mountain peak.

column2: vt.  mark a test, list of questions, etc. with a tick, in order to show that sth. is correct, to choose sth., etc. 给（试卷、问题等）打钩号
column3: e.g. She is used to [[ticking]] off all of the things that she has done before the end of the day.；e.g. The clock on the wall [[ticked]] away, its sound echoing through the otherwise silent room.

column2: vi.(also ~ away) if a clock or watch ticks, it makes a short repeated sound （钟表）发出嘀嗒声
column3: e.g. She is used to [[ticking]] off all of the things that she has done before the end of the day.；e.g. The clock on the wall [[ticked]] away, its sound echoing through the otherwise silent room.

column2: 1) very unpleasant to experience, esp. because of involving a difficult choice or a long wait （尤因难以抉择或等待过久而）折磨人的
column3: e.g. For two [[agonizing]] minutes the plane dived, shook, and finally landed safely at the airport.；e.g. It was said that a few months ago Mr. Lin died after suffering years of [[agonizing]] pain.

column2: 2) extremely painful 十分痛苦的
column3: e.g. For two [[agonizing]] minutes the plane dived, shook, and finally landed safely at the airport.；e.g. It was said that a few months ago Mr. Lin died after suffering years of [[agonizing]] pain.

column2: [C] (also headlamp) （车辆的）前灯；车头灯（的光束）
[C, U] 雾
(fml.) breathe out the air or smoke, etc. in our lungs 呼出，吐出（肺中的空气、烟等）；呼气
column3: e.g. I changed my breathing pattern, inhaling and [[exhaling]] heavily after each set of exercise.

column2: [C] 水肺；自携式水下呼吸器
[C, usu. pl.] （潜水、游泳时用的）手蹼，脚蹼
help sb. to do sth. 协助；帮助
column3: e.g. Families [[assisted]] teachers with the achievement of educational goals.

column2: 1) come back up to the surface of the water 重新露出水面
column3: e.g. When the [[divers]] did not [[resurface]] after an hour, three crew members dived down to look for them.；e.g. She [[resurfaced]] briefly about eight years later, to compete with Noriko again for $5 million.

column2: 2) appear again after being lost or missing （遗失或失踪后）再次出现
column3: e.g. When the [[divers]] did not [[resurface]] after an hour, three crew members dived down to look for them.；e.g. She [[resurfaced]] briefly about eight years later, to compete with Noriko again for $5 million.

column2: (only before noun) relating to the heart 心脏的
column3: e.g. It is generally believed that patients with [[cardiac]] problems should avoid foods that are high in salt.

column2: 心脏停搏；心搏停止
(only before noun) below the surface of an area of water, or able to be used there 水下的；水下（使）用的
column3: e.g. Each guide also includes full-color [[underwater]] photographs illustrating the marine life you could expect to see.

column2: 1) if you look at sb. / sth. keenly or watch them keenly, you look closely at them and notice everything about them （观察）敏锐地
column3: e.g. I looked at him [[keenly]]; he did not blink or even seem embarrassed by what he had just said.；e.g. Scientists are [[keenly]] interested in learning which substances make fruits and vegetables so healthful.

column2: 2) very strongly 强烈地
column3: e.g. I looked at him [[keenly]]; he did not blink or even seem embarrassed by what he had just said.；e.g. Scientists are [[keenly]] interested in learning which substances make fruits and vegetables so healthful.

column2: (fml.) cover or wrap sb. / sth. up completely 包住；覆盖
column3: e.g. The mist and rain [[enveloped]] the forest and we could only see the nearest trees.

column2: [C, usu. sing.] a large area of land that has never been developed or farmed 未开发的地区；荒野；荒凉之处
column3: e.g. As we could see from the film, this place used to be a vast [[wilderness]] of mountains, lakes, and forests.

column2: 1) the limit of what is known about sth. 未完全开拓的领域；新领域
column3: e.g. The study of the brain is often described by scientists as the next intellectual [[frontier]].；e.g. Many of the cars crossing the [[frontier]] were stopped and searched for illegal goods.

column2: 2) (esp. BrE) the border of a country 国界；边境
column3: e.g. The study of the brain is often described by scientists as the next intellectual [[frontier]].；e.g. Many of the cars crossing the [[frontier]] were stopped and searched for illegal goods.

column2: [C] a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement （因违反法律、规则或合约而受到的）惩罚，处罚
column3: e.g. The contract includes heavy [[penalties]] for those people who fail to complete the work on time.

column2: (only before noun) relating to the sea and the creatures that live there 海洋的；海洋生物的
column3: e.g. We are all quite familiar with news items concerning [[marine]] pollution due to oil spills.

column2: [C] a very small amount of sth. 一点；少量
column3: e.g. Employees' salaries are just a [[fraction]] of the total cost of the project.

column2: 1) the act of traveling through a place in order to find out about it or look for sth. in it 勘探；勘查；探索
column3: e.g. You can use this hut as a base for [[explorations]] into the mountains and forests around.；e.g. This chapter begins with a detailed [[exploration]] of the issue of gender discrimination among all age groups.

column2: 2) an examination of sth. in order to find out about it 探究；研究；探测
column3: e.g. You can use this hut as a base for [[explorations]] into the mountains and forests around.；e.g. This chapter begins with a detailed [[exploration]] of the issue of gender discrimination among all age groups.

column2: 1) (esp. of people) strange and interesting because you do not know much about them 神秘的；陌生的
column3: e.g. I decided to find out more about my [[mysterious]] new neighbor who lived on the top floor.；e.g. The police are investigating the [[mysterious]] disappearance of a new-born baby at the hospital.

column2: 2) difficult to understand or explain; strange 神秘的；奇怪的；不易理解的
column3: e.g. I decided to find out more about my [[mysterious]] new neighbor who lived on the top floor.；e.g. The police are investigating the [[mysterious]] disappearance of a new-born baby at the hospital.

column2: 1) [sing.] (~ of) a small number of people or things 少数人或物
column3: e.g. The new book is by a man who's already written a [[handful]] of best-sellers, most of them about space exploration.；e.g. The boy picked up a [[handful]] of stones and started throwing them at us, which made us annoyed.

column2: 2) [C] (~ of) the amount that you can hold in your hand 一把（的量）
column3: e.g. The new book is by a man who's already written a [[handful]] of best-sellers, most of them about space exploration.；e.g. The boy picked up a [[handful]] of stones and started throwing them at us, which made us annoyed.

column2: [C] 水手；海员
[C] sb. / sth. that is dangerous 危险的人或事物
column3: e.g. Drivers like that are a [[menace]]. They shouldn't be allowed on the road.

column2: [C] 猿
sometimes but not often 偶尔；偶然；有时
column3: e.g. We no longer keep up a close friendship, though we still visit each other on [[occasion]].

column2: according to the conditions that sb. wants 按照···的条件；根据···的主张
column3: e.g. Don't just accept this job because it would make your parents happy — you need to act on your own [[terms]] for once.

column2: [C] any of the large systems of stars, etc. in outer space 星系
column3: e.g. Observations of distant [[galaxies]] indicate that they are moving away from us and the universe is expanding.

column2: connected with the planet Earth 地球的；地球上的
column3: e.g. Technology gives us immense power over nature, and our decisions will affect all [[terrestrial]] life.

column2: (fml.) make it necessary for you to do sth. 使成为必需；需要
column3: e.g. Sales have dropped dramatically, [[necessitating]] big cuts in production and employment.

column2: relating to the watching of sb. / sth. in order to learn new things 观察的；观测的
column3: e.g. We film in an [[observational]] style, following events over a period of months to see how things turn out.

column2: [C] one of the things from which sth. is made, esp. one of the foods that are used together to make a particular dish 成分；（尤指烹饪）原料
column3: e.g. Meals are prepared by the chef on board using fresh [[ingredients]] which are bought daily.

column2: v.travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth or the Sun 沿轨道运行；环绕···运行
column3: e.g. The Earth is one of several planets that [[orbit]] the Sun, and the Moon [[orbits]] around the Earth.；e.g. These planets have circular (环形的) [[orbits]] similar to the [[orbits]] of planets in our solar system.

column2: n.[C] the curved path traveled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth or the Sun （环绕地球、太阳等运行的）轨道
column3: e.g. The Earth is one of several planets that [[orbit]] the Sun, and the Moon [[orbits]] around the Earth.；e.g. These planets have circular (环形的) [[orbits]] similar to the [[orbits]] of planets in our solar system.

column2: 1) [C]（太阳等恒星的）耀斑
column3: e.g. A sudden [[flare]] of light caused her to raise her right arm protectively across her face.

column2: 2) [C, usu. sing.] a bright but unsteady light or flame that does not last long （短暂的）旺火；（摇曳的）光；（闪耀的）火光
column3: e.g. A sudden [[flare]] of light caused her to raise her right arm protectively across her face.

column2: vt.remove sth. that is covering the surface of sth. else 剥去，除去（表面的东西）
column3: e.g. I think we should [[strip]] the old paint off and see what the wood is like underneath.；e.g. The islands are separated by a narrow [[strip]] of water.

column2: n.a long narrow area of land, sea, etc. （陆地、海域等）狭长地带；带状水域
column3: e.g. I think we should [[strip]] the old paint off and see what the wood is like underneath.；e.g. The islands are separated by a narrow [[strip]] of water.

column2: [C] (pl. axes) the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns （旋转）轴；轴线
column3: e.g. The Earth and many other planets in the solar system rotate on their [[axes]] and revolve around the Sun.

column2: become or make sth. become firm, steady and unlikely to change （使）稳定，稳固
column3: e.g. He suffered a second heart attack two days ago but his condition has now [[stabilized]].

column2: of or related to an axis 轴的；轴线的
column3: e.g. The Moon's presence also slows the [[axial]] rotation of the Earth, which is why we could have 24-hour days.

column2: [C, U] a position in which one end or side of sth. is higher than the other; an act of tilting sth. to one side 倾斜；倾侧
column3: e.g. Since childhood, we have been learning the languages of the eyes, the hands and those subtle [[tilts]] of the head.

column2: vt.protect sb. / sth. from being harmed or damaged 保护；保卫
column3: e.g. He wrapped himself in his heavy coat and sat in the corner where the bamboo leaves [[shielded]] him from the wind.

column2: n.[C] 盾；盾牌
column3: e.g. He wrapped himself in his heavy coat and sat in the corner where the bamboo leaves [[shielded]] him from the wind.

column2: causing a lot of destruction, suffering, or death 灾难性的；毁灭性的
column3: e.g. The movie shows heroes risking their lives to save the Earth from a [[catastrophic]] collision with a comet (彗星).

column2: used when you describe sth. using part of a well-known expression 俗话说的；常言道
column3: e.g. There are some observers who make predictions all the time about economic recessions, the collapse of civil society, and the [[proverbial]] "end of the world."

column2: [C] a planet that is not in the solar system 系外行星
column3: e.g. Astronomers say that this unique observing technique opens a new phase in the exploration of [[exo-planets]].

column2: [U] the branch of biology that investigates the possibility of life elsewhere in the universe 天体生物学
[C] a belief or opinion that you have already formed before you know the actual facts, and that may be wrong 事先形成的看法（想法）；先入之见；成见
column3: e.g. Try to go into the meeting without too many [[preconceptions]] about what the other group wants.

column2: of or relating to the action of water under conditions of high temperature, esp. in forming rocks and minerals 热液的
[C] an opening that allows air, gas or liquid to pass out of or into a room, building, container, etc. （空气、气体、液体的）出口，进口，漏孔
column3: e.g. Make sure that jars have tight lids and are kept away from sunlight and heating [[vents]].

column2: 1) [U] the fact of sb. / sth. not existing or not being available; a lack of sth. 不存在；缺乏
column3: e.g. The case was dismissed in the [[absence]] of any definite proof.；e.g. The smell of cigarette smoke confirmed what he had suspected: There had been a party in his [[absence]].

column2: 2) [C, U] when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away 不在；缺席
column3: e.g. The case was dismissed in the [[absence]] of any definite proof.；e.g. The smell of cigarette smoke confirmed what he had suspected: There had been a party in his [[absence]].

column2: reasonable and likely to be true or successful 貌似有理的；似乎是真的
column3: e.g. A more [[plausible]] explanation would seem to be that people are fed up with their routine life.

column2: (~ to sth.) making it easy, possible or likely for sth. to happen 有助于···的发生
column3: e.g. Our ultimate goal is to create a culture that is [[conducive]] to continual progress and learning.

column2: [C, usu. pl.]1) sth. that you must have in order to do sth. else 必要条件；必备的条件
column3: e.g. Success in the examination did not secure by itself a postgraduate position, but it was the minimum [[requirement]].；e.g. The average daily food [[requirement]] is about 2,000 calories for women and 2,500 for men.

column2: 2) sth. that you need or want 所需的（或所要的）东西
column3: e.g. Success in the examination did not secure by itself a postgraduate position, but it was the minimum [[requirement]].；e.g. The average daily food [[requirement]] is about 2,000 calories for women and 2,500 for men.

column2: [C, U] a very thin piece of skin that covers or connects parts of your body （覆盖或连接身体某些部分的）膜；薄膜
column3: e.g. Exposure to loud noise from fireworks can damage the delicate [[membrane]] in the ear.

column2: containing water or similar to water 含水的；似水的
column3: e.g. In chemistry, an [[aqueous]] solution or cream has water as its base.

column2: [C] 放射性同位素
1) the process by which a radioactive substance changes to a different form, producing radiation （放射性物质的）衰变
column3: e.g. The study did not find any association between secondhand smoke exposure and [[decay]] in permanent teeth.

column2: 2) the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of sth. 腐烂；朽烂
column3: e.g. The study did not find any association between secondhand smoke exposure and [[decay]] in permanent teeth.

column2: relating to or coming from the heat inside the Earth 地热的；地温的
column3: e.g. The ice sheet acts like a huge blanket that locks in the [[geothermal]] heat that comes naturally from the Earth.

column2: (only before noun) (of an animal) living apart from the main group, and possibly dangerous 离群的
column3: e.g. It's reported that [[rogue]] elephants have killed at least 31 people in that area this year.

column2: suitable for people to live in 适合居住的
column3: e.g. We are constantly looking for new [[habitable]] areas.

column2: (esp. AmE) (also enquire esp. BrE) ask sb. for some information 询问；打听
column3: e.g. I called the school to [[inquire]] about the application process.

column2: (esp. AmE) (also enquiry esp. BrE)1) [U] the act of asking questions or collecting information about sb. / sth. 查询；探究；探索
column3: e.g. On further [[inquiry]], it emerged that Malcolm had not been involved in the incident.；e.g. An [[inquiry]] will be held to discover why the local school's educational record is so bad.

column2: 2) [C] an official process to find out the cause of sth. or to find out information about sth. 调查；查究；查问
column3: e.g. On further [[inquiry]], it emerged that Malcolm had not been involved in the incident.；e.g. An [[inquiry]] will be held to discover why the local school's educational record is so bad.

column2: (only before noun) relating to a planet or planets 行星的
column3: e.g. This means a huge step forward in understanding how [[planetary]] systems form and evolve.

column2: [U] 光谱术；光谱学
ask questions in order to find out secret or hidden information about sb. / sth. 盘问；追问；探究
column3: e.g. We have been [[probing]] the reasons why the government has been so slow to react to the problem of climate change.

column2: (usu. before noun) happening, expected, or needed during a particular season 季节性的；时令的；当令的
column3: e.g. One major factor causing [[seasonal]] variations in food supplies was the difficulty of storage.

column2: (also periodical) (only before noun) happening a number of times, usu. at regular times 周期（性）的；定期的
column3: e.g. Do a [[periodic]] review of your lecture notes and the relevant chapters in your textbooks.

column2: [C] 中微子
[C] a person or animal that lives in a particular place 居民；栖居的动物
column3: e.g. According to the report, the city's first [[inhabitants]] arrived in the 16th century.

column2: [U] the fact or process of noticing or discovering sth. 觉察；发现；侦察；探测
column3: e.g. There should be a more effective treatment for patients identified through early [[detection]].

column2: 1) [C, usu. pl.] a quality or power that a substance, plant, etc. has 特性；性质；属性
column3: e.g. For practical purposes the solar spectrum (光谱) is divided into regions with characteristic [[properties]].；e.g. Please take care of your own belongings. The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests' personal [[property]].

column2: 2) [U] the thing or things that sb. owns 所有物；资产；财产
column3: e.g. For practical purposes the solar spectrum (光谱) is divided into regions with characteristic [[properties]].；e.g. Please take care of your own belongings. The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests' personal [[property]].

column2: 1) (~ yourself  to doing sth.) allow yourself or sb. to have only a limited amount of sth. or to do only a particular kind of activity 约束；限制
column3: e.g. The senator said he would voluntarily [[restrict]] himself to $2.2 million in campaign spending.；e.g. Because of limited space, the number of people who can attend the ceremony is [[restricted]] to 35.

column2: 2) limit the size, amount or range of sth. 限制，限定 （大小、数量、范围等）
column3: e.g. The senator said he would voluntarily [[restrict]] himself to $2.2 million in campaign spending.；e.g. Because of limited space, the number of people who can attend the ceremony is [[restricted]] to 35.

column2: (only before noun) of or connected with the Sun 太阳的
column3: e.g. An increase in the number of dark spots on the Sun marks a period of high [[solar]] activity.

column2: (usu. passive) make sb. / sth. certain to fail, die, be destroyed, etc. 使注定（失败、死亡、毁灭等）
column3: e.g. A rare star system has been found in our Milky Way galaxy, but it is [[doomed]] to end in a massive explosion.

column2: relating to things that exist outside the Earth 地球外的；宇宙的；外星的
column3: e.g. Over the years, we've been conditioned to accept the possibility of [[extraterrestrial]] life through movies and reports about alien encounters.
